Monday 3rd October 2011
United Nations Day, 2011
Dear Parents,
Here at ISM we take pride in celebrating the cultural heritage of all of our students and this is never more evident than during our UN Day celebrations. In past years we have received much welcome support from parents in organising activities for the children and the days have been a wonderful success and for that we are very grateful.
On the Upper Campus for this year’s UN Day we have decided to take a different approach to previous years and there will be much more responsibility placed in the hands of the students. The students (Years 4 – 9) will break into houses for two days in order to prepare some pieces to present to the rest of the campus. Each house will focus on one particular country and they will have several tasks to present. Wednesday 26th October will be a preparation day where specialist teachers will be on hand to support the children in the relevant areas, and Friday 28th October will allow half a day for preparation and the students will come together and share their work in the afternoon.
Children will present in the following categories:
· A piece of artwork
· A performance (musical/dramatic/sport)
· Presentation of information about the country
· Teach a basic aspect of the language
We have chosen a variety of countries that will best represent the cultural diversity of the students in our school. The countries have been assigned to houses as follows:
Normans – Italy
Romans – Japan
Saxons – Iran
Vikings – Columbia
We welcome parental support in helping the children to prepare for the event at home and as an additional task we encourage the children to try their hand at making some traditional dishes from these countries, in order to share with the other students on our celebration day on Friday 28th October.
